description: Parameter descriptors for company financials tools - specifically financial line items

parameters.description: The specific financial line item to retrieve. Must match exact parameter names from the allowed list. Categories include: Income Statement items (revenue, expenses, profits), Balance Sheet items (assets, liabilities, equity), Cash Flow items (operating, investing, financing), and Financial Ratios.

examples.revenue: Basic revenue from primary business operations, excludes other income sources
examples.total_revenue: Complete revenue including all income streams (operating + non-operating revenue)
examples.net_income: Bottom-line profit after all expenses, taxes, and extraordinary items
examples.gross_profit: Revenue minus cost of goods sold, shows profitability before operating expenses
examples.operating_income: Profit from core business operations, excludes interest and taxes (EBIT)
examples.cost_of_goods_sold: Direct costs of producing goods or services sold during the period
examples.research_and_development: Expenses for developing new products, technologies, or services
examples.selling_general_and_administrative: Overhead costs including sales, marketing, and administrative expenses
examples.total_debt: Sum of all short-term and long-term debt obligations
examples.total_current_assets: Assets expected to be converted to cash or used within one year
examples.total_current_liabilities: Debts and obligations due within one year
examples.total_stockholders_equity: Shareholders' ownership stake in the company (assets minus liabilities)
examples.cash_and_cash_equivalents: Most liquid assets including cash, money market funds, and short-term investments
examples.accounts_receivable: Money owed by customers for goods or services delivered on credit
examples.inventory: Value of raw materials, work-in-progress, and finished goods held for sale
examples.property_plant_and_equipment: Physical assets used in operations (buildings, machinery, equipment)
examples.accounts_payable: Money owed to suppliers and vendors for goods or services received
examples.long_term_debt: Debt obligations with maturity dates beyond one year
examples.retained_earnings: Cumulative profits kept in the business rather than paid as dividends
examples.common_stock: Par value of shares representing basic ownership in the company
examples.preferred_stock_convertible: Preferred shares that can be converted into common stock
examples.additional_paid_in_capital_preferred_sto: Amount received above par value from preferred stock issuance
examples.goodwill: Intangible asset representing premium paid in acquisitions above fair value
examples.interest_expense: Cost of borrowing money, including interest on debt and loans
examples.income_tax_expense: Taxes owed on taxable income for the reporting period
examples.operating_cash_flow: Cash generated from core business operations
examples.free_cash_flow: Operating cash flow minus capital expenditures, available for distribution
examples.capital_expenditures: Cash spent on acquiring or upgrading physical assets (capex)
examples.dividends_paid: Cash distributions to shareholders from company profits
examples.earnings_per_share: Net income divided by average shares outstanding
examples.book_value_per_share: Shareholders' equity divided by total shares outstanding
examples.return_on_assets: Net income divided by total assets, measures asset efficiency
examples.return_on_equity: Net income divided by shareholders' equity, measures shareholder returns
examples.total_debt_to_equity: Total debt divided by shareholders' equity, measures financial leverage
examples.total_depreciation_and_amortization: Non-cash expenses for asset deterioration and intangible asset write-offs
examples.total_other_non_operating_income: Income from activities outside core business operations
examples.total_receivable: Total amount owed to the company by customers and other parties

parameters.description: List of company identifiers (ticker symbols, ISINs, CUSIPs, or company_ids). Always pass multiple identifiers in a single call when possible.
common_mistakes: Making separate API calls for each company instead of batching identifiers
Not using array format for single identifiers

parameters.description: Specifies whether to retrieve annual or quarterly data. Required when requesting quarterly data.
common_mistakes: Forgetting to set period_type to 'quarterly' when requesting quarterly data

parameters.description: Starting year for the data range. Use calendar years, not fiscal years.
common_mistakes: Using fiscal years instead of calendar years
Not specifying when requesting historical data ranges

parameters.description: Ending year for the data range. Use calendar years, not fiscal years.
common_mistakes: Using fiscal years instead of calendar years

parameters.description: Starting quarter (1-4) when requesting quarterly data. Only used with period_type='quarterly'.
common_mistakes: Using string values like 'Q1' instead of integer 1

parameters.description: Ending quarter (1-4) when requesting quarterly data. Only used with period_type='quarterly'.
common_mistakes: Setting end_quarter before start_quarter in same year
Using string values like 'Q4' instead of integer 4
